snippet: Researchers suggest physical activity increases the flow of blood and oxygen to the brain and may lead to increased levels of norepinephrine and endorphins.
abstract: Studies led by Amika S Singh and published in journal The Archives of Pediatrics & Adolescent Medicine find that physical exercise in children improves not only cardiovascular health but also academic performance.
lead_paragraph: Researchers suggest physical activity increases the flow of blood and oxygen to the brain and may lead to increased levels of norepinephrine and endorphins.

headline.seo: Exercise Yields Dividends in the Classroom, Studies Suggest
headline.main: Childhood: Exercise Yields Dividends in the Classroom
headline.print_headline: Childhood: Exercise Yields Dividends in the Classroom
